metadata.title: CVE-2022-1919 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in Codecs in Google Chrome prior to 101.0.4951.41 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTMLpage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1919` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
